alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Clark; Jackson; Taylor; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 18 at 10:35AM CST until February 19 at 12:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... * WHAT...West winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. Snow showers moving through in the early afternoon. * WHERE...In Wisconsin, Taylor, Clark, Buffalo, Trempealeau and Jackson Counties. In Minnesota, Wabasha and Winona Counties. * WHEN...From noon today to midnight CST tonight. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Reduced visibilities below a mile with any falling snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures quickly fall late this afternoon and evening. This may lead to a flash freeze of any roads that are wet from melting snow.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
